title: Rambles in the Old World
author: Terry, Milton Spenser.
snippet: A short walk from this statue brings us tothe site of the old Roman Camp, now knownas the Citadel. Here we find a most interesting monument, a gray old mass of stone, saidto have been erected by the Roman legions inhonor of Nero Claudius Drusus, the illustriousconqueror of numerous German tribes, whohere ended his brilliant career in 9 B. C. by

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: Tbe members of the British Archæological Associationvisited the Roman Camp at Ardoch, Doune Castle, andDunblane Cathedral. The excursion was one of the mostextended of the series, and unfortunately it had to be madewith all the discomforts of rain and muddy roads.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: It was well that we had made an early start, for,though Arbuthnot had no doubt that we would reachWestermains before sunset, we had still a long waybefore us. We, therefore, entered a little inn whichstood at the side of the road near the Roman Camp,and asked for food. They could give us nothing toeat but cakes of oatmeal, which were very dry, andsome tough salt beef.
